intro: Paraboea salicina, commonly known as the silver leaf paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has slender, climbing stems and is often found in open forests and shrublands. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery down. It plays a role in supporting local insect populations and is of interest in ecological studies.
